message.content:
To compare two columns in a pandas DataFrame, you can use the `plot()` method and pass in the names of the columns as arguments. For example:
```
import pandas as pd

# create a sample dataframe
data = {'A': [1, 2, 3, 4, 5], 'B': [6, 7, 8, 9, 10]}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# plot the two columns
df.plot('A', 'B')
```
This will create a line plot that shows the relationship between the values in column A and B. You can customize the plot as needed by using various options such as `kind`, `xlabel`, `ylabel`, etc.

You can also use the `plotly` library to create more interactive plots. Here is an example:
```
import pandas as pd
import plotly.graph_objs as go

# create a sample dataframe
data = {'A': [1, 2, 3, 4, 5], 'B': [6, 7, 8, 9, 10]}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# plot the two columns using plotly
fig = go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=df['A'], y=df['B']))
fig.show()
```
This will create an interactive line plot that shows the relationship between the values in column A and B. You can customize the plot as needed by using various options such as `layout`, `title`, etc.
